channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Elon and Vivek have ‘talked about having a naughty list and a nice list for members of Congress’
item.description: Musk and entrepreneur Vivek Ramaswamy delivered a warning to Republicans who don't go along with their plans to slash spending.

item.title: Pitching investors is like the NFL draft says Colin Kaepernick—’it only takes one’
item.description: At Fortune’s Brainstorm AI conference, the former 49ers quarterback said that startup founders will often hear “no”—but need to keep looking for the i...

item.title: Live Updates: Israel Says It Destroyed Syria’s Navy, Part of Wave of Post-Assad Attacks
item.description: Israel has said it is striking Syrian military sites and chemical weapons stockpiles to prevent them from falling “into the hands of extremists.” The ...

item.title: Trump Mocks Trudeau and Canada in Post on Tariffs and Trade
item.description: The president-elect’s mockery of Canada and its leader is the latest salvo after his promise to impose steep tariffs on Canadian exports.

item.title: Police Arrest 3 After Deadly Explosion in the Netherlands
item.description: The blast, which the mayor of The Hague called an “unprecedented disaster,” killed six people on Saturday morning.

item.title: Luigi Mangione was found with a 3D-printed ‘ghost gun’ as authorities and the Supreme Court rush to regulate the untraceable weapons anyone can make
item.description: Ghost guns have increasingly turned up at crime scenes around the U.S. in recent years.

item.title: Netanyahu Finally Takes the Stand in His Corruption Trial
item.description: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel is accused of bribery, fraud and breach of trust in a trial that began four years ago. He has denied the c...

item.title: End of Trump tax cuts would see 62% pay more—how Congress may respond
item.description: From lower federal rates to the cap on state and local property tax deductions, there is much at stake.

item.title: Arctic Tundra Has Long Helped Cool Earth. Now, It’s Fueling Warming.
item.description: Wildfires and thawing permafrost are causing the region to release more carbon dioxide than its plants remove, probably for the first time in thousand...

item.title: Police Arrest 3 After Deadly Explosion in the Netherlands
item.description: The blast, which the mayor of The Hague called an “unprecedented disaster,” killed six people on Saturday morning.

item.title: Nikki Giovanni, Poet Who Wrote of Black Joy, Dies at 81
item.description: As a writer, she tackled race, gender, sex, politics and love. She was also a public intellectual who appeared on television and toured the country.

item.title: Met Museum Unveils Design for New Modern Wing
item.description: The architect Frida Escobedo has drawn on her Mexican heritage in reimagining the galleries for Modern and contemporary art.

item.title: It’s not just about cholesterol. 1 in 5 have high levels of this artery-clogging substance that can lead to heart disease
item.description: It’s not only cholesterol that’s worrisome: Elevated levels of lipoprotein(a) increase your risk of heart attack and stroke.

item.title: New York to Close Giant Family Shelter to Protect Migrants From Trump
item.description: The imminent closure reflects concern from New York City officials that President-elect Donald J. Trump will target the shelter because it sits on fed...
